newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - Oct 25.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - Oct 25.

text.p: Microsoft Corp is gathering up its industry allies to propose a simpler, less expensive personal computer in order to counter a threat from a new kind of network computer, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.
- New York State health insurer Empire Blue Cross & Blue Shield has signed a contract with Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center.
- Tobacco analyst Gary Black's objectivity has come under question after he accepted then rejected a job to help Carl Icahn fight RJR's board.
- Trans World Airlines Inc said Jeffrey Erickson will resign as its chief executive officer.
- Wired magazine cancelled itS initial public offering.
- Lucent Technologies Inc posted strong earnings for its first quarter.
- Cable giant TCI released preliminary quarterly results that fell short of expectations.
- Procter & Gamble Co reported record profit for the first quarter.
- General Motors Corp temporarily shut down its Lordstown Ohio plant after it ran out of parts.
- Boeing Co posted a 13 percent increase in quarterly earnings.
- Quaker Oats Co reported strong quarterly earnings.
- U.S. loan demand remains strong among lower- and middle- income consumers.
- A Goldman Sachs partner plans to challenge incumbent Patrick Arbor for CBOT leadership.
- The Dow Jones industrial average lost 43.98 points to close at 5,992.48.
- Bond prices drifted lower as the U.S. dollar closed lower.
- Wall Street fears that President Bill Clinton will win next month's elections by such a strong margin that his Democratic Party will take over one or both houses of Congress.
- U.S. bond market is drifting as investors wait for key third-quarter economic indicators to come next week.
